Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of delicate glasses like Pyrex to avoid thermal cracking; starting at 100W for light contamination, max below damage threshold (~500W for short pulses). Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics and Coherent for 1064 nm systems; academic paper on glass cleaning (Opt. Lasers Eng., 2018).
Near-IR wavelength providing good absorption in surface contaminants while minimizing bulk Pyrex absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with controlled thermal effects
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
